content:
• Monday, October 26, 2015
  • RMBS

    Rambus launches $100M accelerated buyback (updated)

    • Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) is launching a $100M accelerated buyback (ASR) with Citi. The company will receive an initial delivery of 7.8M shares (over 6% of outstanding shares, current value of $80M).
    • The move comes a week after Rambus nosedived thanks to a Q3 miss and soft Q4 guidance. The chip IP licensing firm had $362.9M in cash to pay for buybacks with at the end of Q3, and $119.4M in convertible debt. Prior to the ASR, Rambus was free to repurchase 20M shares through its existing buyback program (launched in January).
    • Shares haven't yet moved after hours.
    • Update (8:25PM ET): Rambus closed after hours trading up 2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 PM
  • MDP

    Time Inc. purchases pair of female-focused websites

    • Time Inc. (TIME -1.6%) has acquired female-focused Web properties xoJane.com and xoVain.com, The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • It's the latest in a string of digital purchases for the print veteran. Last week, the company bought HelloGiggles, the brand co-founded by actress Zooey Deschanel.
    • Jane Pratt, the magazine veteran who edits both the sites, will join Time along with her editorial team and move to the publisher's new NYC headquarters later in the year.
    • Time sees buying the two sites -- xoJane drew 2.5M unique visitors in September (up 104% in two years), and xoVain drew 958K unique visitors -- as a move to increase its reach to younger women and boost ads for beauty and style.
    • Previously: Time Inc. buys millennial-women brand HelloGiggles (Oct. 19 2015)
    • Previously: Time buys firms, rolls them into Sports Illustrated Play youth-sports unit (Jul. 07 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 PM
  • PDCE

    PDC Energy CFO Shellum to retire

    • PDC Energy (PDCE -4%) says Chief Financial Officer Gysle Shellum will retire from the company.
    • The move is effective June 30. Shellum has been CFO since joining the company in 2008.
    • He'll serve until a successor is appointed, and assist with the transition.
    • Previously: Schlumberger out, Franks in among Credit Suisse top energy stock picks (Oct. 07 2015)
    • Previously: CRZO, CXO, GPOR, PDCE can "easily survive at $35" oil, SunTrust says (Sep. 01 2015)
    • Previously: PDC Energy +11% after Q2 miss but raises full-year guidance (Aug. 10 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM
  • CAKE

    Cheesecake Factory issues light guidance; shares -5.8%

    • The Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE) used its Q3 earnings call to guide for Q4 EPS of $0.50-$0.53, below a $0.54 consensus. The restaurant chain also forecast 2016 EPS of $2.56-$2.68, below a $2.67 consensus at the midpoint.
    • Shares have fallen to $48.98 after hours, adding to the losses initially seen after CAKE posted mixed Q3 results and reported 2.2% Y/Y comparable restaurant sales growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • TACO

    Del Taco prices secondary offering at $12/share

    • Del Taco (TACO -3.9%) has priced its secondary offering of 3.37M shares at $12/share.
    • After falling as much as 7.8% today after news of the secondary broke, the stock finished down 3.9% to $12.26.
    • Underwriters will have a 30-day option to buy up to an additional 505K shares. Del Taco isn't selling any shares in the offering, expected to close Oct. 30.
    • After hours, shares are down a bit more, -0.3% to $12.23.
    • Previously: Del Taco Restaurants lower after secondary announced (Oct. 26 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 PM
  • OIBR.C

    Bloomberg: Telecom Italia leaning against $4B offer for TIM tie-up

    • Brazil's Oi SA (OIBR) gave up some morning gains -- fueled by a $4B offer to tie up with TIM Participações -- to finish up 8.9%, as TIM's majority owner Telecom Italia (TI +1%) indicated it would likely snub the offer.
    • Bloomberg says that Telecom Italia is inclined to pursue a Brazil strategy as a stand-alone, though it continues to review options including a deal with Oi. TIM (NYSE:TSU) gave up some gains as well, finishing U.S. trading up 5.8%.
    • Through his LetterOne, Russian billionaire Mikhail Fridman offered to put $4B into Oi if it combined with TIM. Fridman was looking for exclusive terms for his investment firm to negotiate the deal.
    • Last year, Oi and TIM both took close looks at acquiring the other; the two combined have about 44% of the local wireless market. Brazil's economy is shrinking, but market leader Telefonica Brasil (VIV +4.4%) is predicting that smartphone penetration and mobile data use will grow by at least 10% this year.
    • Previously: Oi up 14.9% as it receives multibillion-dollar offer tied to TIM combination (Oct. 26 2015)
    • Previously: Moody's downgrades ratings for Oi SA (Oct. 07 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM
  • MSTR

    MicroStrategy down 11.4% on sales miss, 15% license/subscription drop

    • After rising 3% Y/Y in Q2, MicroStrategy's (NASDAQ:MSTR) product license and subscription service revenue (drives future support revenue) fell 15% Y/Y in Q3 to $34.1M. Product support revenue fell 5% to $71.4M, and other services revenue 33% to $24.1M.
    • Competition from a long list of business intelligence software vendors - the list includes Microsoft, Oracle, IBM, SAP, Qlik, and Tableau - could be weighing on sales. As might the impact of major job cuts: Operating expenses fell 40% Y/Y to $74.1M, allowing EPS to beat estimates in spite of a revenue miss.
    • MicroStrategy ended Q3 with $456.9M in cash (compares with a $1.98B market cap). Shares have fallen to $173.85 after hours.
    • Q3 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: IDTI +10.5%. MT +9.8%. ONE +6.8%. EW +6.1%. AU +2.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: HCLP -14.7%. RCII -19.0%. MRVL -15.3%. MSTR -12.4%. AMKR -8.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 5 Comments
  • MRVL

    Marvell auditor PwC resigns; shares -15.3%

    • PricewaterhouseCoopers has resigned as Marvell's (NASDAQ:MRVL) independent registered accounting firm. Marvell adds its Audit Committee didn't "request, recommend, or approve" PwC's resignation.
    • Marvell: "PwC has advised the Company that it would need to expand the scope of the 2016 audit in the following areas: (1) the Company's entity level controls, including whether senior management's operating style resulted in an open flow of information and communication to set an appropriate tone for an effective control environment, (2) the Company's process and controls over establishment of significant and judgmental reserves, including reserves for litigation and royalties, (3) the Company's process and controls over identification, communication and approval of related party transactions, including assignment of intellectual property rights and (4) the adequacy of financial reporting resources, including sufficient personnel with appropriate knowledge, expertise and training commensurate with the Company's corporate structure and financial reporting requirements. Due to its resignation, PwC did not undertake to expand the scope of the audit."
    • The news comes less than two months after Marvell disclosed an Audit Committee probe into revenue recognition issues and management's operating style, and less then three weeks after interim CFO Sukhi Nagesh was reassigned.
    • Shares have plunged to $8.00 after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • IDTI

    IDT +11.4% post-earnings; $310M acquisition announced, $300M added to buyback

    • Along with its FQ2 results, IDT (NASDAQ:IDTI) has announced it's buying ZMDI, a German provider of power management, battery management, sensor, and LED driver ICs for auto and industrial clients, for $310M in cash.
    • With ZMDI producing quarterly revenue of $20M, IDT is paying roughly 4x sales. The company's gross margin (currently 57%) is expected to top 60% once cost synergies are reaped.
    • IDT: "IDT gains immediate leverage for new designs in Wireless Charging, Power Management, and Timing & Signal Conditioning ... ZMDI's signal conditioning products provide an elegant interface between microcontrollers and analog components, such as sensors. This is extremely complimentary to IDT's Advanced Timing products, and will enable intelligent systems that are aware of their surroundings, and can adjust system performance, timing, and power management automatically."
    • Separately, IDT's buyback authorization has been upped by $300M to $531M. That's good for repurchasing 15% of shares at current levels. IDT plans to pay for the additional $300M via debt, and promises to "execute this portion of our buyback on an accelerated pace."
    • IDT's FQ2 top-line performance is attributed to "a strong rebound in sales of our communications products, continued market leadership in memory interface, as well as solid contributions from our wireless charging business." EPS benefited from a 70 bps Q/Q and 220 bps Y/Y increase in gross margin (non-GAAP) to 63.4%.
    • Shares have jumped to $26.27 after hours, making new 52-week highs along the way.
    • FQ2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 2 Comments
  • HCLP

    Hi-Crush Partners suspends distribution

    • Hi-Crush Partners (NYSE:HCLP) -14.9% AH on news it is suspending its quarterly distribution due to challenging market conditions.
    • HCLP says the suspension "is about prudent preservation of capital, building market share and positioning Hi-Crush for the eventual market turnaround. We continue to believe the fundamentals for increased frac sand demand over the long-term are favorable, but the recovery will take longer than previously thought."
    • HCLP follows peer Emerge Energy as the second frac sand producer in recent days to suspend its distribution; EMES -2.6%, SLCA -1.5%, CRR -0.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 45 Comments
  • GRUB

    GrubHub gains 3.4% with solid results expected tomorrow

    • GrubHub (NYSE:GRUB) gained 3.4% today ahead of an earnings report tomorrow morning that comes in a new competitive environment for the food delivery company.
    • Analysts expect revenue growth to slow for the second quarter in a row, to 40% Y/Y, as heavy hitters like Amazon.com and Uber make their own moves in the space, along with Yelp via its acquisition of Eat24.
    • Consensus expectations are for GrubHub to post EPS of $0.14 on revenues of $86.5M for the third quarter.
    • Meanwhile, Susquehanna Group issued a bullish report on the company today, as analyst Shyam Patil said solid results should come tomorrow. Patil thinks the company is well positioned to take advantage as takeout shifts from offline to online, and that margins will expand given time.
    • On Friday, RBC Capital reiterated its Outperform rating with a $42 price target. From today's close of $32.09, that implies more than 30% upside from here. The firm's focusing on unique active diners (GrubHub ended the last quarter with 5.8M) and take rate, which was 15.5% last quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • GORO

    Gold Resources' Q3 production falls short of target, lowers full-year outlook

    • Gold Resources (NYSEMKT:GORO) -3.2% AH after reporting Q3 production of 6,825 oz. of gold and ~562K oz. of silver, and lowering its FY 2015 outlook to 29.6K oz. of gold and 2.5M oz. of silver, which represent a reduction to the low end of the original 2015 outlook.
    • GORO says it saw improvements during Q3 in mine development, water management and mining conditions, but overall production was less than targeted largely due to lower than projected grades and higher mining dilution sustained mostly during August.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • KN

    Knowles down 8.5% following mixed Q3, soft Q4 sales guidance

    • In addition to missing Q3 revenue estimates (while beating on EPS), Knowles (NYSE:KN) is guiding for Q4 revenue of $290M-$310M, below a $313.6M consensus. EPS guidance of $0.18-$0.24 is in-line with a $0.22 consensus.
    • CEO Jeffrey Niew: "In our mobile consumer segment, we saw a strong sequential sales increase driven by significant growth at a North American OEM, new product launches from a Korean OEM and normal seasonality. This growth was partially offset by lower sales to Chinese OEMs. Sales of specialty components were down slightly due to softer-than-expected timing device demand and lower hearing health sales following a very strong second quarter."
    • The "North American OEM" is almost certainly Apple; Knowles reportedly grew its iPhone microphone count with the iPhone 6S/6S+. The "Korean OEM" is likely Samsung, which rolled out the Galaxy Note 5 during Q3.
    • No explanation is given for Knowles' Q4 guidance. However, it comes after fellow iPhone supplier Dialog Semi missed Q3 estimates and provided a soft Q4 outlook. Chip packaging/testing firm Amkor, which also depends heavily on iPhone sales, has also guided light.
    • Financials: Boosting Q3 EPS: Gross margin was 32.1%, +70 bps Y/Y and slightly above a 30%-32% guidance range. Thanks to the Audience acquisition, operating expenses rose to 24.7% of revenue from 18.1% a year ago. Knowles ended Q3 with $57.9M in cash, and $474.8M in debt.
    • Shares have fallen to $19.10 after hours.
    • Q3 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • HIG

    Lower investment income, higher catastrophe losses sting Hartford results

    • Q3 core earnings of $364M or $0.86 per share vs. $477M and $1.06 one year ago. This even as the float fell 6% thanks to buybacks.
    • At issue was a 10% decline in net investment income and higher catastrophe losses. Stripping out catastrophes, the commercial lines combined ratio improved by 100 basis points Y/Y to 91. The underlying personal lines combined ratio however deteriorated 470 bps to 95.6.
    • Book value per share (excl. AOCI) of $42.99, up 8% Y/Y. Today's close was $48.84.
    • The company has about $1.7B remaining to buy back shares prior to Dec. 31, 2016.
    • Conference call tomorrow at 9 ET
    • Previously: Hartford Financial misses by $0.12, misses on revenue (Oct. 26)
    • HIG -4.8% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • IAC

    IAC/InterActive beats by $0.23, beats on revenue

    • IAC/InterActive (IACI): Q3 EPS of $1.01 beats by $0.23.
    • Revenue of $838.6M (+7.2% Y/Y) beats by $32.55M.
    • Shares +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • NWS

    News Corp. unit Foxtel putting equity boost into Australia's Ten

    • The Australian pay TV unit of News Corp. (NWS -2%, NWSA -1.9%) and Telstra (OTCPK:TLSYY -1.3%) is putting A$77M into broadcaster Network Ten, as the latter announced a heavy fiscal-year loss of A$312M.
    • Ten is raising that amount from existing shareholders as well by offering shares at A$0.15 each, compared to its share price of A$0.19 before a halt.
    • Ultimately, Foxtel -- which was established in 1995 as a joint venture -- will achieve a 15% stake in Ten. Its original bidding partner, Discovery, dropped out of the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • AMKR

    Amkor down 4.8% due to light Q4 guidance

    • Though Amkor (NASDAQ:AMKR) beat Q3 estimates, it's guiding for Q4 revenue of $660M-$710M and EPS of -$0.02 to $0.05, below a consensus of $740.9M and $0.07.
    • CEO Steve Kelley: "In response to the generally soft end market demand for electronic devices, we expect customers to cautiously manage inventories through the fourth quarter of 2015." The 2015 capex budget has been cut by $25M to $525M; it was cut by $50M in July.
    • Q3 details: Boosting EPS: Gross margin was 17.2%, up 160 bps Q/Q and -120 bps Y/Y, and above a 13%-16% guidance range. Q4 GM guidance is at 13%-17%. 55% of revenue was tied to Communications end-markets (mobile devices, Wi-Fi), 13% from Automotive, 12% from Consumer, 12% from Networking, and 8% from Computing (PCs, servers, printers). Chip packaging was 85% of revenue, and testing 15%.
    • Shares have fallen to $5.38 after hours, after dropping 1.7% in regular trading. Amkor's guidance comes after Dialog Semi, which also depends strongly on Apple sales, posted a Q3 miss and issued soft Q4 guidance. Apple and various suppliers sold off in regular trading in response.
    • Q3 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • RCII

    Weak guidance wallops Rent-A-Center

    • Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII) slumps after guidance disappoints.
    • The company sees Q4 EPS of $0.52-$0.60 vs. $0.68 consensus and full-year EPS of $2.00-$2.10 vs. $2.15 consensus.
    • Previously: Rent-A-Center beats by $0.02, misses on revenue (Oct. 26 2015)
    • RCII -16.93% after hours to $21.40.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • ELGX

    Endologix buys TriVascular Tech for $211M

    • Endologix (NASDAQ:ELGX) acquires TriVascular Technologies (NASDAQ:TRIV) in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $9.10 per TRIV share or $211M. The stock portion of the deal will be equal to 19.999% of ELGX's outstanding shares while the cash portion will be determined at the closing date and will be based on the value of TRIV options, restricted stock units, warrants, and, if applicable, the conversion of TRIV convertible debt. When the transaction closes in January, ELGX shareholders will own ~84% of the shares of the combined company.
    • Endologix CEO John McDermott says, "This merger enhances the near and long-term growth potential of our business by bringing together two of the most innovative companies in the field of endovascular abdominal aortic aneurysm treatment."
    • TRIV is up 54% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAKE

    Q3 net income increases at Cheesecake Factory

    • Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE) reports comparable-restaurants sales rose 2.2% in Q3.
    • Cost of sales rate -100 bps to 23.9% of total sales.
    • Labor expenses rate flat at 31.7%.
    • Restaurant count +2 Y/Y to 194.
    • Development guidance: The company plans to open as many as 11 company-owned restaurants in the U.S. during FY15 and 3 international franchised locations.
    • Previously: The Cheesecake Factory beats by $0.03, misses on revenue (Oct. 26 2015)
    • CAKE -1.58% after hours to $51.17.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • CAKE

    The Cheesecake Factory beats by $0.03, misses on revenue

    • The Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE): Q3 EPS of $0.59 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $526.69M (+5.5% Y/Y) misses by $8.26M.
    • Shares +4.35%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • PMCS

    PMC - Sierra beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • PMC - Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS): Q3 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $133.57M (-1.4% Y/Y) beats by $4.95M.
    • Shares +1.03%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • IDTI

    Integrated Device Tech beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Integrated Device Tech (NASDAQ:IDTI): FQ2 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $169.5M (+23.6% Y/Y) beats by $1M.
    • Shares +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • UQM

    UQM Technologies +82% after signing supply deal with Chinese firm

    • UQM Technologies (UQM +82.5%) skyrockets on news it signed a 10-year China supply agreement with a subsidiary of Eastlake New Energy, with revenues to the company potentially exceeding $400M; shares halted.
    • UQM says the deal provides electric propulsion systems for three market segments: 6-8 meter shuttle buses, light- to medium-duty delivery trucks, and 10-12 meter transit buses.
    • UQM says it has received the first purchase order for an initial 3K units, which are expected to ship in 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • S

    Sprint halves severance pay in latest cost control measure

    • Sprint (S +1.6%) is cutting severance pay in half -- which may be presaging more layoffs amid the company's latest round of cost controls.
    • The company is cutting severance pay to one week of pay per year worked at Sprint, from the previous two, for employees notified after Jan. 30 of their layoff.
    • Last fall about this time, Sprint cut 458 employees. The company is in the middle of a new cost-cutting push, with CFO Tarek Robbiati vowing it will cut $2.5B from a "bloated" structure.
    • Previously: Sprint to target 'bloated' structure with $2.5B in cost cuts (Oct. 09 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 45 Comments
  • DUK

    Duke Energy overpaying for Piedmont Natural Gas, analyst says

    • Duke Energy (DUK -2%) is paying too much for Piedmont Natural Gas (PNY +36.7%) in "almost any reasonable scenario," Citigroup’s Praful Mehta asserts.
    • DUK is paying ~$4.9B, a $1.4B premium (~40%) vs. PNY's Oct. 23 closing price and close to 4x book value, and "no synergy bridge gets you to $1.4B," Mehta says, also noting the premium is relative to a 52-week high stock price for PNY.
    • Mehta considers the deal "a red flag" on management's direction: "Firstly, is there a meaningful problem in the growth profile of the underlying business (LatAm)? Secondly, would management rather destroy value to hold on to a growth target that may not be achievable rather than realign growth targets?"
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 8 Comments
  • PDS

    Precision Drilling likely facing a dividend cut, analyst says

    • Ongoing losses at Precision Drilling (PDS -7.5%) suggest the need for a dividend cut, Scotiabank analyst Vladislav Vlad says, but he thinks the move would be a positive given the pricing pressures associated with an oversupplied Tier 1 drilling market in North America.
    • The analyst sees PDS as a top driller but weighed by persistent industry headwinds, and notes that its dividend is at risk due to restricted payment covenants on its debt if there are further losses and asset impairments.
    • Vlad’s models imply a 12% Y/Y decline in activity and 7% lower day rates.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • NTAP

    NetApp -4.2%; UBS downgrades to Sell, cites latest checks

    • Stating his firm's latest storage reseller checks point to "continued weakness for NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP)," UBS' Steve Milunovich has downgraded to Sell and cut his target by $4 to $30.
    • Milunovich: "All FAS [storage] products scored below zero on a strong-weak scale. NetApp's FlashRay all-flash offering is still not generally available. Most concerning, the Dec quarter outlook registered the lowest score ever." He adds Gartner has lowered NetApp's position in its disk array Magic Quadrant - NetApp is still one of seven firms in the "Leaders" quadrant.
    • On the bright side, Milunovich likes NetApp's Clustered Data ONTAP software solution for its FAS arrays, is pleased with new CEO George Kurian's efforts to redeploy resources, and thinks the Dell/EMC deal could present near-term opportunities to grab share. However, he's worried EMC could grab share long-term as it begins selling through Dell channels, and believes Office 365's growth is also a threat, given NetApp filers are often used for e-mail storage.
    • Separately, storage analyst Mark Peters provides a fairly positive take on NetApp's Data Fabric strategy (involves pairing NetApp arrays with software for managing both on-premise and cloud storage) after attending the 2015 NetApp Insight conference.
    • Peters: "Now of course the Data Fabric isn’t a simple SKU – but then neither is it simply PowerPoint-ware; it is one of the most compelling and comprehensive 'data anywhere and everywhere, single management, cloud-inclusive' constructs you’ll find ... the idea is in line with some of the more forward thinking startups that you would've thought of. Really, NetApp seems to have the right technology and the right strategy ... It's just in their court to execute."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan -4% as investors react negatively to funding plan

    • Kinder Morgan (KMI -4.2) slides as investors appear to turn thumbs down on the company's plan to issue $1.6B of mandatory convertible preferred stock.
    • KMI is offering 32M depositary shares, with an underwriters option to purchase another 4.8M shares; prior to this offering, there was no public market for the depositary shares.
    • Investors were looking for an alternative non-equity funding based on last week's announcement, and perhaps the newest plan is not what was expected.
    • Fitch Ratings affirms its BBB- rating on KMI, but the agency says the $1.6B preferred equity issuance eases some uncertainty around the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 103 Comments
  • HRL

    Cancer report and downgrade weigh on meat sector

    • Tyson Foods TSN is down 4.76% after JPMorgan takes off a bull call on the meat stock with shares at record levels.
    • The slide could also be tied to an announcement from the World Health Organization on the cancer risk from processed meat.
    • Hormel (HRL -1%), Sanderson Farms (SAFM -0.7%), Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -1.7%), and Seaboard (SEB -0.3%) are also lower on the day.
    • Full report from the International Agency for Research on Cancer
    • Previously: WHO to reveal red meat cancer risk (Oct. 26 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 12 Comments
  • EQR

    Multi-family market top mulled as Zell unloads apartments

    • "The planned sales will likely raise questions regarding the apartment cycle as well as the 'call' for certain submarkets and asset types," says Cowen's James Sullivan, as Equity Residential (EQR +2.2%) announces the sale of $5.3B of apartment properties and looks to sell another $700M worth next year.
    • Zell rung a bell for the top of the last real estate cycle with the early 2007 sale of his Equity Office Properties for $39B.
    • Citi's Michael Bilerman acknowledges the sale should make good fodder for the bears, but he remains bullish on EQR. Wells Fargo's Jeffrey Donnelly is impressed with the timing, and applauds EQR for narrowing its focus on larger properties in core urban markets.
    • Previously: Equity Residential sells chunk of holdings for $5.365B (Oct. 26)
    • Other multi-family REITs: AvalonBay (AVB -0.5%), Essex Property (ESS -0.6%), Post Properties (PPS -0.1%), UDR (UDR -0.2%), Aimco (AIV +0.1%), Mid-America (MAA -0.3%), Investors Real Estate (IRET -0.1%), Independence Realty (IRT -2.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • OXM

    Oxford Industries fights back from Friday tumble

    • Oxford Industries (OXM +4.6%) perks up after Sidoti initiates coverage with a rousing Buy rating on a valuation call.
    • Shares of Oxford trade right in the middle of their 52-week range of $50.13 to $91.24. Oxford took a tumble on Friday after peer VF Corp missed earnings estimates with its Q3 report.
    • Previously: V.F. misses by $0.05, misses on revenue (Oct. 23 2015)
    • Previously: Strong underlying sales growth at VF Corporation (Oct. 23 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • STM

    STMicro -4.6%; French/Italian governments reportedly support cutting dividend

    • Bloomberg reports the French and Italian governments, which collectively own 27.5% of STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM), want the chipmaker to cut its dividend to give it more flexibility to up its R&D spend.
    • STMicro currently sports a 5.1% yield, well above that of most dividend-paying chip stocks. Meanwhile, the company is expected by the Street to see revenue drop 4.5% in 2015. Sales have been pressured by the ST-Ericsson JV wind-down, weak PC sales, set-top IC competition from Broadcom, and microcontroller competition from a variety of rivals.
    • Shares have fallen towards $7.50. In addition to Bloomberg's report, a weak Q3 report from fellow European chipmaker Dialog Semi could be weighing. STMicro's Q3 results arrive on Thursday morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • CHK

    Natural gas -8% as forecasts call for warmer than average weather

    • Natural gas futures are down ~8% as supplies rise toward record levels amid expectations of a warm start to the winter, sending shares of energy companies with heavy exposure to natural gas sharply lower; CHK -8.7%, SM -7.7%, RRC -7.4%.
    • Adding to the volatility is the expiration of the November futures contract Wednesday, which recently was trading at $2.06/MMBtu, a level last seen in 2012.
    • "This could be a blow off bottom," says Again Capital's John Kilduff, who says the price is hit by expectations that a record amount of natural gas will soon be in storage; weekly data show gas storage at 3.81T cf vs. a record 3.93T cf in November 2012.
    • Weather forecasts released last night called for “significant warm trends” across much of the U.S. in the next two weeks, according to MDA Weather Services.
    • Crude oil prices also are lower, as lingering concerns over a global supply glut and weakening demand send prices toward their lowest settlement in six weeks.; WTI -1.5% at $43.95/bbl, Brent -0.8% at $47.61.

  • RIG

    Transocean's delivery delays to bring relief now but pain later, analyst says

    • Transocean’s (RIG -2.1%) decision to delay the delivery two new rigs is good news for 2016 but bad news for 2018, according to Citigroup analyst Scott Gruber.
    • The one-year delay will allow RIG to postpone the vast majority of the $927M of capex associated with the rigs that was slated for 2016, but is offset by the loss of cash flow from each rig for a year, as the $519K/day contracts are worth ~$120M/year in EBITDA per rig; assuming capex is deferred 12 months and the net cash flow difference is neutral, Gruber says the additional discounted year would imply a negative effect on RIG's anticipated distributable cash flow.
    • Gruber alos believes the $240M of lost EBITDA will hurt RIG's liquidity position in 2017-18, and may cause RIG to need to issue ~$1B in new equity to strengthen its liquidity position by 2018.

As for a heavy ad-industry review season: "Results to date in the tsunami of largely U.S.-based media investment management reviews have been highly satisfactory with major retentions and wins and limited losses, and with significant opportunities still to be decided, where we have relatively limited exposure."
    • The company will hold an investor briefing in London Nov. 18.

    • Believing online bookings act as "a game-changer" for its vacation rental marketplace, Cowen's Kevin Kopelman has upgraded HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY) to Outperform ahead of its Nov. 4 Q3 report, and hiked his target by $6 to $40.

  • OIBR.C

    Oi up 14.9% as it receives multibillion-dollar offer tied to TIM combination

    • Oi SA (OIBR) is up 14.9% premarket in U.S. trading, following its receipt of a proposal from LetterOne that could put $4B into the company if it combines with TIM Participações (NYSE:TSU).
    • LetterOne, the investment firm controlled by Russian billionaire Mikhail Fridman, is seeking exclusive terms to negotiate a deal between Oi and its rival. Oi says that adviser Grupo BTG Pactual handed over the proposal to its board.
    • Shares in TIM are up 3.1% premarket on the NYSE; Telecom Italia (NYSE:TI), which owns a majority of TIM, are up 0.8% in Milan.
    • Funding from LetterOne would help Oi with a debt pile that exceeds 38B reais ($9.9B). While TIM has denied being in talks with Oi, sources say a tie-up could bring more than 20B reais in synergies.
